newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY RADIO NOON HEADLINES - DEC 9.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY RADIO NOON HEADLINES - DEC 9.

text.p: These are the main headlines on Hungary's Kossuth Radio midday news. Reuters cannot vouch for their accuracy:
- Prime Minister Gyula Horn's candidate for the welfare minister's post is Welfare Ministry secretary of state Mihaly Kokeny.
- The first soldiers of the U.S. contingent in the IFOR peace-keeping force landed in Taszar, southwest Hungary, one year ago.
- Hungary's ambassador to the NATO officially informed the organisation about Hungary's plans to take part in the mission of the SFOR peace-implementation force.
- The social security's Healthcare Fund said its 1996 deficit will be 10 billion forints higher than the target in the fund's supplementary budget.
- The parliament group of the ruling coalition's senior party MSZP voted down proposals for asking the Constitutional Court to review the draft law about conflict of interest.
- Representatives of local municipality archives said part of the documents were perishing due to the lack of funds.
